xxl.cursors
Class SingleObjectCursor

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--xxl.cursors.AbstractCursor
        |
        +--xxl.cursors.SingleObjectCursor
public class SingleObjectCursor
extends AbstractCursor

A SingleObjectCursor returns a user-specified object only for one time.

Example usage: 

 	SingleObjectCursor singleObjectCursor = new SingleObjectCursor(new Integer(1));
 	while(singleObjectCursor.hasNext())
 		System.out.println(singleObjectCursor.next());
 	singleObjectCursor.close();
This instance of a SingleObjectCursor returns the Integer-object with value 1 for one time. Therefore the condition of the while-loop, method hasNext, is set to false when this given object is printed to the output stream for the first time.

See Also:
AbstractCursor

Method Detail

computeNext

protected void computeNext()
The next element is not computed in a SingleObjectCursor. So this method is empty.
Overrides:
computeNext in class AbstractCursor

reset

public void reset()
           throws UnsupportedOperationException
Resets the SingleObjectCursor to its initial state. (optional operation)
That means hasNext is set to true, so the caller is able to receive his specified object again by calling the next method.
Overrides:
reset in class AbstractCursor
Throws:
UnsupportedOperationException - if the reset method is not supported by this SingleObjectCursor. (not possible)
